data.title: Ivan The Terrible Was The Grand Prince Of Russia - 1480 Words
data.meta_description: Free Essay: Ivan IV, also called Ivan the Terrible, was the Grand Prince of Russia in the 16th century from the years 1533-1584. During his long reign as...
data.text:
Ivan IV, also called Ivan the Terrible, was the Grand Prince of Russia in the 16th century from the years 1533-1584. During his long reign as Russiaâ€™s leader, he transformed Russia from a small futile country to an empire. Because of his success in the government and taking control of neighboring lands this led him into becoming the first czar in 1547. Ivan the Terrible increased the power and position of Russia politically and militarily by defeating and slaughtering all those that got in his way and creating trade and political alliances with the people who supported his polices and goals he set out to achieve. Ivan The Terrible was born in 1530, Ivan was only three years old when he took the Russian throne because of his father 's unfortunate death. When he was seven his own nobles poisoned and killed his mother. While he was a young child he had a very hard life, he had nobody to look after him or take care of him. He was often molested as a child and neglected, this having some effect on his rule as he grew older. To get food he would have to walk around begging others for scraps, keep in mind this was his own empire. (Biography.com Editors)

The palace was a dangerous place to live as he was growing up it was common for people to come in and take whatever they wanted they would steal, cheat, murder and do anything they wanted because he could not stop them.
